history.content:
Hey everyone! Just wanted to start out by congratulating everyone on making it through these last couple months to the best of their abilities. All of us have been through incredible changes and are in the middle of adjusting to this new normal. However even on the worst of days, there is some comfort in the knowledge that during our time at Berkeley we’ve managed to build communities around us that we can rely on as a source of support. 

And that feeling of community and shared responsibility is what we want to extend to our incoming class of Baby Bears. They’re going to be entering college in a time like no other. In addition to the usual doubts we all had as new students regarding housing, course advice, how to use Cal Central (still not sure how the four year planner works), meal plans, and more, the class of 2024 will be facing uncertainties that we can’t begin to put into words. And these concerns won’t be coming from just a logistical standpoint: now more than ever, it would mean the world to them to know that they have a community of welcomers ready to make this transition as emotionally and mentally easy as possible. 

That’s where we’d love your support. Linked below is an interest form to sign up to be a volunteer advisor over the summer for the incoming class. The exact details of what this role would entail are listed out on the website (bit.ly/bear-advising) but TLDR: you’ll be asked to select what categories you feel comfortable giving advice on and then will be added to a relevant Slack channel where:

  1. Members of the incoming class can post questions.

  2. You can answer them when you have the time.

We’re essentially taking the idea of the “Course Advice” group on Facebook and extending it to all types of advice (think campus clubs, greek life, dorm experiences), distributed through open forums on Slack. Plus the website will serve as a one-stop resource for some other cool advising methods we’re going to be experimenting with (eg. Live Q&As on Zoom). 

To fill out the interest form, use this link. We’d love to get as many people on board so we can provide a range of advice and guidance across backgrounds, majors, and organizations on campus. 

Feel free to reach out to us, if you have any questions at arthvid@berkeley.edu or priyansdesai@berkeley.edu

Thank you all so much for reading through this. Let’s help the class of 2024 put a positive spin on their unforgettable entry into Berkeley. Go Bears!
history.subject: Want to Help out Class of 2024?
